facts.fact: MGH is home to the University of Washington's world-class iSchool, but also hosts a series of other departments.
Curious about jobs? You'll find answers at the career center here!
The CLUE tutoring center is located in this hall.
UW students work hard, so the HUB is a place for them to grab a bite, hang out, or study.
Make sure to take a look at the bowling alley and gaming area downstairs.
The HUB was rebuilt in 2011 - 2012 to better suit the needs of modern students.
Once every year, a duck ramp is built at the fountain so baby ducks can climb in and out.
This beautiful icon of the UW campus has been around since 1909.
It is against state law to clip the roses surrounding Drumheller Fountain.
The Burke Museum is home to over 6 million artifacts (only some of which are on display)
The Burke Museum is currently home to the original mask that inspired the Seahawks logo.
Make sure the check out the delicious cafe downstairs!
Entrace to the Burke is free for UW students, so there's no reason to NOT check it out!
Paccar Hall is home to the prestigious Foster School of Business.
Paccar Hall was lucky enough to have the first Starbucks franchise store on campus!
Dempsey Hall, connected to Paccar, is the newest hall on campus. This is a nice juxtaposition to Denny, right next door: the oldest building on campus.
Expect to see students lounging on the grass, playing in the trees, or throwing Frisbees out here on a sunny day!
The iconic cherry trees were donated to the UW from our sister school in Japan.
